Module dev.blaauwendraad.masker.json
Package dev.blaauwendraad.masker.json.config

Class JsonMaskingConfig.Builder

java.lang.Object
dev.blaauwendraad.masker.json.config.JsonMaskingConfig.Builder
Enclosing class:
JsonMaskingConfig
public static class JsonMaskingConfig.Builder extends Object
Builder to create JsonMaskingConfig instances using the builder pattern.

    • allowKeys

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder allowKeys(String... keys)
      Only allow the given key to be unmasked, mask JSON values corresponding to any other key.

      This method is incompatible with any mask method, except cases when a specific key(s) or JSONPath(s) needs to be masked with a specific KeyMaskingConfig masking configuration.

      Returns:
      the builder instance

    • allowKeys

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder allowKeys(Set<String> keys)
      Only allow the given keys to be unmasked, mask JSON values corresponding to any other key.

      This method is incompatible with any mask method, except cases when a specific key(s) or JSONPath(s) needs to be masked with a specific KeyMaskingConfig masking configuration.

      Returns:
      the builder instance

    • allowJsonPaths

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder allowJsonPaths(String... jsonPath)
      Only allow the given JSONPath to be unmasked, mask JSON values corresponding to any other key.

      This method is incompatible with any mask method, except cases when a specific key(s) or JSONPath(s) needs to be masked with a specific KeyMaskingConfig masking configuration.

      Returns:
      the builder instance

    • allowJsonPaths

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder allowJsonPaths(Set<String> jsonPaths)
      Only allow the given JSONPaths to be unmasked, mask JSON values corresponding to any other key.

      This method is incompatible with any mask method, except cases when a specific key(s) or JSONPath(s) needs to be masked with a specific KeyMaskingConfig masking configuration.

      Returns:
      the builder instance

    • caseSensitiveTargetKeys

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder caseSensitiveTargetKeys()
      Configures whether the target keys are considered case-sensitive (e.g. cvv != CVV)

      Default value: false (target keys are considered case-insensitive)

      Returns:
      the builder instance

    • maskStringsWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskStringsWith(String value)
      Mask all string values with the provided value. For example, "maskMe": "secret" -> "maskMe": "***".

      Masking strings with '***' is the default behaviour if no string masking option is set.

      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskStringCharactersWith(String)
      • maskStringsWith(ValueMasker.StringMasker)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskStringsWith(String)

    • maskStringCharactersWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskStringCharactersWith(String value)
      Mask all characters of string values with the provided character, preserving the length. For example, "maskMe": "secret" -> "maskMe": "******".
      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskStringsWith(String)
      • maskStringsWith(ValueMasker.StringMasker)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskStringCharactersWith(String)

    • maskStringsWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskStringsWith(ValueMasker.StringMasker valueMasker)
      Mask all string values with the provided ValueMasker.
      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskStringsWith(String)
      • maskStringCharactersWith(String)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskStringsWith(ValueMasker.StringMasker)

    • maskNumbersWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskNumbersWith(String value)
      Mask all number values with the provided value. For example, "maskMe": 12345 -> "maskMe": "###".

      Masking numbers with '###' is the default behaviour if no number masking option is set.

      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskNumbersWith(int)
      • maskNumberDigitsWith(int)
      • maskNumbersWith(ValueMasker.NumberMasker)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskNumbersWith(String)

    • maskNumbersWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskNumbersWith(int value)
      Mask all number values with the provided value. For example, "maskMe": 12345 -> "maskMe": 0.
      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskNumbersWith(String)
      • maskNumberDigitsWith(int)

    • maskNumberDigitsWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskNumberDigitsWith(int digit)
      Mask all digits of number values with the provided digit, preserving the length. For example, "maskMe": 12345 -> "maskMe": 88888.
      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskNumbersWith(String)
      • maskNumbersWith(int)
      • maskNumbersWith(ValueMasker.NumberMasker)

    • maskBooleansWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskBooleansWith(String value)
      Mask all boolean values with the provided value. For example, "maskMe": true -> "maskMe": "&&&".

      Masking booleans with '&&&' is the default behaviour if no boolean masking option is set.

      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskBooleansWith(boolean)
      • maskBooleansWith(ValueMasker.BooleanMasker)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskBooleansWith(String)

    • maskBooleansWith

      public JsonMaskingConfig.Builder maskBooleansWith(boolean value)
      Mask all boolean values with the provided value. For example, "maskMe": true -> "maskMe": false.
      Returns:
      the builder instance
      See Also:
      • maskBooleansWith(String)
      • maskBooleansWith(ValueMasker.BooleanMasker)
      • KeyMaskingConfig.Builder.maskBooleansWith(boolean)

      the builder instance
